item.title: 波音公司与两起 737 MAX 坠机事故受害者家属达成诉讼和解
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司与埃塞俄比亚航空公司一架波音737 MAX客机于2019年3月坠毁事件中两名遇难者的家属在庭审前夕达成和解。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing settled lawsuits with the families of two victims killed in the March 2019 crash of an Ethiopian Airlines Boeing 737 MAX on the eve of trial, lawyers for the families said.】

item.title: 关税风暴肆虐 "华丽七重奏"，苹果逼近一年新低
item.description: 由于投资者担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全球关税战会带来金融后果，"华丽七国 "股票周一下挫，延续了市场的颓势，其总价值已减少约 2 万亿美元。【原文：The "Magnificent Seven" stocks sank on Monday, extending a market rout that has wiped off around $2 trillion from their combined value as investors worry about the financial fallout of U.S. President Donald Trump's global tariff war.】

item.title: 美国信贷息差继续扩大，未宣布新债券
item.description: 由于担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税战可能导致经济衰退，信用利差或发行成本继续上升，美国投资级和高收益债券市场连续第三天没有宣布新的债券发行。【原文：No new offerings were announced in the U.S. investment-grade and high-yield bond markets for the third consecutive day as credit spreads or the cost of issuance continued to increase on worries that U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff war could lead to a recession.】

item.title: 工程软件初创公司 Rescale 从应用材料公司和英伟达公司融资 1.15 亿美元
item.description: Rescale 是一家位于旧金山的初创公司，主要生产用于设计赛车和计算机芯片的工程软件，该公司周一获得了 1.15 亿美元的风险融资。【原文：Rescale, a San Francisco-based startup that makes engineering software used to design race cars and computer chips, raised $115 million on Monday in venture financing.】

item.title: 华尔街最新下调标准普尔 500 指数年度目标的是美国银行和奥本海默公司
item.description: 博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）和奥本海默资产管理公司（Oppenheimer Asset Management）周一成为最新一批下调美国 500 指数（S&P 500 index）年底目标至 6000 点以下的华尔街研究公司，以应对全球贸易战深化带来的风险。【原文：BofA Global Research and Oppenheimer Asset Management on Monday became the latest Wall Street research firms to cut their year-end targets for the S&P 500 index to below the 6,000 mark in response to risks from a deepening global trade war.】

item.title: 比特币创 2025 年新低，美国加密货币类股大跌
item.description: 由于关税紧张局势升级和对全球贸易战的担忧引发了风险资产的广泛撤退，在美国上市的加密公司股价在周一开盘前暴跌，与比特币的大幅下跌如出一辙。【原文：U.S.-listed shares of crypto companies tumbled before the markets opened on Monday, mirroring a sharp drop in bitcoin as escalating tariff tensions and fears of a global trade war triggered a broad retreat from risk assets.】

item.title: 亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司与现代重工签署造船合作谅解备忘录
item.description: 美国军用造船厂亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司（Huntington Ingalls）和韩国现代重工公司（HD Hyundai Heavy Industries）周一表示，两家公司已签署协议，探讨增加商业和国防项目生产的机会。【原文：U.S. military shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls and South Korea's HD Hyundai Heavy Industries have signed an agreement to explore opportunities to increase production in commercial and defense projects, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 经济衰退风险加剧，欧洲央行利率可能加速下降
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税计划引发的全球市场溃败巩固了欧洲央行下周再次降息的理由，并支持了世界第二大央行更快放宽政策的论点。【原文：A global market rout induced by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs scheme has solidified the case for another ECB rate cut next week and supports arguments for even quicker policy easing from the world's second largest central bank.】

item.title: 加拿大就美国汽车关税向世贸组织提起争端
item.description: 世界贸易组织周一表示，加拿大已就美国总统唐纳德-特朗普决定对来自加拿大的汽车和汽车零部件征收25%的关税一事请求与美国进行世贸组织争端磋商。【原文：Canada has requested WTO dispute consultations with the United States over President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 25% duty on cars and car parts from Canada, the World Trade Organization said on Monday.】

item.title: 分析师称，在美国关税影响下，德国可能面临第三个经济萎缩年
item.description: 分析人士说，美国宣布的关税将对德国经济造成重大打击，推迟经济复苏，并可能使欧洲最大的经济体历史上首次步入第三年衰退的轨道。【原文：The tariffs announced by the United States will deal a major blow to the German economy, delaying a recovery and possibly putting Europe's biggest economy on track for a third year of recession for the first time in history, analysts said.】

item.title: 汽车咨询公司预测，关税将导致今年美国汽车销量减少 200 万辆
item.description: 据底特律地区一家汽车咨询公司预测，如果全球贸易战升级，美国和加拿大今年的汽车销量可能会减少180万辆，并在未来十年停滞不前。【原文：U.S. and Canada auto sales could decline by 1.8 million vehicles this year and be stagnant over the next decade if the global trade war escalates, a Detroit-area automotive advisory firm forecasts.】

item.title: 比亚迪在欧洲推出高端品牌 Denza 以支持业务扩张
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪周一在欧洲推出高端品牌Denza，旨在支持其在该地区的扩张，并与宝马和奔驰等高端德国制造商竞争。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD launched on Monday its premium Denza brand in Europe, aiming to support its expansion in the region and compete with top-end German manufacturers such as BMW and Mercedes .】

item.title: 商品 石油跌至四年低点，金属因经济衰退担忧而下跌
item.description: 由于中美贸易战愈演愈烈，引发了对原材料需求的担忧，包括金属和咖啡在内的大多数大宗商品市场下跌。【原文：Oil slid around 3% on Monday to its weakest since 2021, while most commodity markets including metals and coffee declined as the intensifying trade war between the United States and China triggered worries over demand for raw materials.】

item.title: Tinder 母公司 Match 拒绝 Anson Funds，任命电子商务资深人士为董事会成员
item.description: Tinder 母公司 Match Group 回击了激进分子 Anson Funds 对其董事会的提名，并于周一任命经验丰富的电子商务高管达雷尔-卡文斯（Darrell Cavens）为新董事。【原文：Tinder parent Match Group pushed back against activist Anson Funds' nominees to its board, and appointed seasoned e-commerce executive Darrell Cavens as a new director on Monday.】

item.title: 精神航空公司首席执行官将卸任
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周一表示，首席执行官泰德-克里斯蒂（Ted Christie）将从公司卸任。【原文：Spirit Airlines said on Monday Chief Executive Officer Ted Christie was stepping down from the company.】

item.title: 市场压力信号闪烁
item.description: 周一，随着全球股市在关税动荡中溃败加剧，整个金融市场的压力迹象开始闪现。【原文：As a rout in global equity markets deepened on Monday amid tariff turmoil, the signs of stress across financial markets have started to flash brightly.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰第一季度交付量下降 7%，原因是中国和欧洲市场需求疲软
item.description: 德国汽车制造商梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）周一表示，受中国和欧洲需求下降的影响，其第一季度轿车和货车的单位销量下降了 7%。【原文：German carmaker Mercedes-Benz said on Monday its first-quarter unit sales of cars and vans fell 7%, hit by declining demand in China and Europe.】

item.title: 欧盟财长将讨论关税对经济的影响
item.description: 欧盟财长会议主席安杰伊-多曼斯基（Andrzej Domanski）在一封邀请信中写道，欧盟财长将于周五讨论如何应对美国对欧盟商品征收关税对欧洲经济增长的预期打击。【原文：European Union finance ministers will discuss on Friday how to tackle the expected blow to Europe's economic growth from tariffs imposed by the United States on EU goods, the chairman of the meeting Andrzej Domanski wrote in an invitation letter.】

item.title: 受汽车关税影响，大众汽车旗下奥迪汽车在美国港口滞留
item.description: 大众汽车公司的奥迪发言人周二表示，由于新征收的25%的汽车关税，该公司将扣留4月2日之后运抵美国港口的汽车，这证实了美国贸易刊物《汽车新闻》（Automotive News）报道的一份发给经销商的备忘录的内容。【原文：Volkswagen's Audi is holding back cars that arrived in U.S. ports after April 2 because of the newly imposed 25% autos tariff, a spokesperson said on Tuesday, confirming the contents of a memo sent to dealers and reported on by U.S. trade publication Automotive News.】

item.title: 全球银行监管集团任命英国央行行长贝利为下任主席
item.description: 由全球金融监管机构组成的金融稳定委员会周一表示，已提名英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）担任下一任主席，任期三年，从今年 7 月开始。【原文：The Financial Stability Board, a group comprising financial regulators around the world, said on Monday it had nominated Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey as its next chair for a three-year term starting in July.】

item.title: 特朗普坚定关税立场，多伦多证券交易所期货创八个月新低
item.description: 加拿大股指期货周一暴跌，因为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）没有表现出放弃其全面关税计划的迹象，这加剧了人们对经济衰退的担忧，给全球市场带来了冲击波。【原文：Canadian stock index futures tumbled on Monday, as recession fears intensified after U.S. President Donald Trump showed no sign of backing away from his sweeping tariff plans, sending shockwaves through global markets.】

item.title: 早间竞价股市再次暴跌，没有 "如果 "或 "看跌
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的关键所在。【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today.】

item.title: 一切都如此昂贵"：玻利维亚人勒紧裤腰带应对新的通货膨胀现实
item.description: 在玻利维亚的高原城市拉巴斯，家庭主妇安吉丽卡-萨帕塔（Angelica Zapata）正在接受新的通货膨胀现实，因为在安第斯国家燃料和美元短缺的推动下，物价以近二十年来最快的速度上涨。【原文：In Bolivia's highland city La Paz, homemaker Angelica Zapata is coming to terms with a new inflation reality as prices rise at the fastest speed in almost two decades, propelled by shortages of fuel and dollars in the Andean country.】

item.title: 乌克兰希望在本周会谈中就矿产交易与美国 "保持一致
item.description: 乌克兰副总理周一表示，乌克兰将于本周派遣一个小组前往华盛顿，就美国提出的更广泛的矿产协议草案进行谈判。【原文：Ukraine will send a team to Washington this week to move forward with negotiations on a more expansive draft for a minerals deal offered by the United States, the deputy prime minister said on Monday.】

item.title: 受关税冲击影响，花旗下调 0-3 个月布伦特原油预期至 60 美元/桶
item.description: 花旗研究公司周一将 0-3 个月布伦特价格预期下调至每桶 60 美元，并将 0-3 个月铜和铝价格预期分别下调至每吨 8,000 美元和每吨 2,200 美元，原因是最新宣布的关税。【原文：Citi Research on Monday lowered its 0-3 month Brent price forecast to $60 per barrel and also reduced its 0-3 month copper and aluminium price forecasts to $8,000 per metric ton and $2,200 per ton, respectively due to the latest tariff announcements.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会主席与汽车、钢铁和制药业高管讨论美国关税对策
item.description: 消息人士和一封信显示，欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩周一与金属行业代表举行了一次电话会议，并在稍后与汽车行业进行了交谈，讨论如何应对美国的关税。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen held a call with metals industry representatives on Monday and was speaking to the automobile sector later to discuss how to respond to U.S. tariffs, sources and a letter showed.】

item.title: 法庭确认苹果公司对英国 "后门 "命令提出上诉
item.description: 英国调查权法庭（IPT）周一证实，苹果公司正在就英国政府要求其为加密云存储系统创建 "后门 "的命令提起上诉。【原文：Apple is appealing against a British government order to create a "back door" to its encrypted cloud storage systems, the Investigatory Powers Tribunal (IPT) confirmed on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙警告说，关税可能会减缓美国经济增长，加剧通货膨胀
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙告诫投资者，美国关税和全球贸易战引发的动荡可能会减缓世界最大经济体的增长，刺激通货膨胀，并可能导致持久的负面影响。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned investors that the turmoil caused by U.S. tariffs and a global trade war could slow growth in the world's largest economy, spur inflation and potentially lead to lasting negative consequences.】

item.title: 本田执行副总裁青山因 "不当行为指控 "辞职
item.description: 本田汽车周一表示，公司已接受执行副总裁青山真治的辞呈，青山真治被指控在工作时间以外的社交聚会上有不当行为。【原文：Honda Motor said on Monday that it had accepted the resignation of Executive Vice President Shinji Aoyama which followed an allegation of inappropriate conduct during a social gathering outside of work hours.】

item.title: 欧洲股市 2025 年开门红熄灭，关税为第一季度盈利蒙上阴影
item.description: 欧洲股市在2025年的开局表现令人印象深刻，但在三个交易日中遭到大量抛售，而高管们则在合计美国关税对供应链的潜在影响，这可能迫使他们放弃之前的财务预测。【原文：European equities' impressive start to 2025 has been obliterated in three sessions of heavy selling, while executives tot up the potential impact of U.S. tariffs on supply chains, possibly forcing them to ditch previous financial predictions.】
